==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=万|alt=万,㸘,𤍚,𢁭,𥝄,𥝅}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
This character has lost its original meaning of “[[scorpion]]”. The derivative {{och-l|蠆}} refers to the original word.

===Etymology===
Three roots can perhaps be distinguished:

# “Scorpion”: See {{och-l|蠆}};
# “Religious dance; sorcery”: Perhaps from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-man||medicine}}. Compare {{cog|bo|སྨན||medicine; she-demons worshipped by common folk}}, {{cog|my|မန်း||utter mystic words to heal or ward off evil}};
# “Ten thousand”: {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} considers the etymology of this sense Sino-Tibetan, and compares it with {{cog|bo|འབུམ||hundred thousand; complete; entire; multifarious}}. Similar words are found in branches of Altaic and Tocharian; here they are treated as very old loanwords from Chinese, per {{zh-ref|Pulleyblank (''apud'' Clauson, 1972)}}, {{zh-ref|Beckwith (2009)}}, {{zh-ref|Adams (2013)}} and {{zh-ref|Tremblay (2005)}}.
